website_summaries.verdict: Thanks to its sharp design, it's easy to imagine this keyboard in the living room or in any high-visibility area. We only wish its touch-sensitive features were more responsive, which especially stings considering the price. If you're willing to accept a $200 keyboard with a few minor flaws, we recommend it.
cons: touch-sensitive pad and volume control are not very responsive

customer_reviews.title: This Keyboard is awesome! I bought it forever ago when it was ...
customer_reviews.text: This Keyboard is awesome! I bought it forever ago when it was first introduced and it still works. Have not a single problem with the battery it also works without using the dongle which is a surprise. Good Buy! If it was the same price it was when I bought it I would purchase it again but now it's 700+ which is insane, not sure why the price is jacked. Maybe because this keyboard is not made anymore
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Holschuh

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: It's been exactly three years since I've had this amazing keyboard and I'm still loving it as much as the first day. It has the best feel of any keyboards I've ever used. The only feature that I don't use is the 'touch pad' as I find the mouse more efficient. The volume control is a nice touch. (I do use it in a pinch if the mouse battery is being charged). The volume control is a convenient feature. The programmable 'hot keys' are great! PROS: - Fantastic feel and responsive keys. - Amazing battery life per charge. - Customizable 'hot keys' - Volume Control - Touch pad CONS: - Touch pad (too small for extended use)
customer_reviews.author: M. M. Chow

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: The trackpad is pathetic. The ONLY marketing point for the purchase. THIS DOES NOT QUALIFY AS AN ILLUMINATED KEYBOARD, REGARDLESS OF THE HOT KEYS. Battery Status key does not light or display at all. Must study keyboard with light at just the right angle to determine that it ALWAYS DISPLAYS a HALF-CHARGE. Click keys and the trackpad are frustrating. The specialty scroll only worked vertically. Design is pretty, Bluetooth is nice. But that just isn't even close to enough to justify the cost. Ergonomically: something is VERY wrong, my left hand is suffering from overuse of the left click button after two weeks. If you rarely need the mouse, it would be just peachy.
customer_reviews.author: neverland

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth keyboard is hands down the best wireless keyboard I've ever owned. It's perfect for use with a Computer connected to a TV. I have it paired to my Mac Mini connected to my TV for using iTunes in cover view and watching movies. The integrated trackpad works perfectly even though I'm not a huge fan of trackpads but with a TV a mouse isn't practical. I think there may be a Mac version available now but I haven't had any problems using the Windows version with my Mac and I'm not sure if the other way around would work as well. This way I can use it with my PC as well. Overall great quality...
customer_reviews.author: Goodneighbor

customer_reviews.title: Simply put.. The greatest keyboard I've ever had.. x2
customer_reviews.text: How often does a computer peripheral go UP in price after it is discontinued? Probably less than most classic cars.. Well, here's your Shelby Cobra in both looks, style and performance. I own two and they both still work flawlessly. My first purchase was in 2007 and my second was in 2011 here at Amazon. I temporarily lost one in storage while living overseas and I'm glad I did at this point. It is too bad Logitech hasn't come up with a replacement / upgrade for the diNovo Edge.. I understand it is pricey for many but lord.. It is worth every dollar..
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what I wanted for my theater media ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted for my theater media center. Mouse pad and keyboard together with rechargeable batteries and charging cradle. Batteries last for months on a single charge... we don't use it as much as some people might. One issue I have is it occasionally doesn't connect, but cycling the power switch on the side of it corrects the problem. This may be a computer side issue, I have only used it on one computer. Another issue is the scrolling function on the mouse works sometimes and can be frustrating when it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: FierceGT

customer_reviews.title: Great after working out a couple of initial quirks
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other wireless keyboards, this one rates a 5+ for its stable connectivity and range, integrated mouse pad, and programmable function keys. I initially discovered a few small quirks - 1. The software that came with the keyboard inverted the zoom keys. The new software downloaded from the Logitec website fixed that. Another thin that I've noticed is that I lose the zoom function when the computer comes out of hibernate. It requires a reboot to fix it. For those of you with a multimedia system and big screen, this is ideal for operating the system from your lazy-boy from across the room. (that's what I'm doing now) I love it. Buy it. There's currently a $30 rebate too.
customer_reviews.author: TCH

customer_reviews.title: Cool, but having some Issues.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for my home theater media computer. For a home theater, I haven't seen a better keyboard. Unfortunately, its not perfect. The problems are that Windows XP and Bluetooth don't play nicely. When your computer is struggling with programs, that will affect Bluetooth mouse connectivity. This would not happen with a traditional mouse. Additionally, the touchpad is only ok. Its about as good as a standard laptop touchpad, but slightly smaller. I have also struggled with dropped connections. Its easy to solve - just turn off and on the keyboard - but its still annoying. These issues and the price tag make this product only average, when it could be great.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D. Heller

customer_reviews.title: Inflation on old tech?
customer_reviews.text: I paid $100 for this thing 9 years ago. Now they want $700. Lol give me a brake. It wasn’t that great back then, I couldn’t imagine how bad it would be to use now. For that kind of money it should have a laptop attached.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Batch

customer_reviews.title: Simply terrible
customer_reviews.text: Simply terrible! Pairing issues with 2 different computers turns this well over $100 keyboard into a expensive coaster..... Won't pair with windows 7, gives incorrect pairing code every time, and I am a computer technician by trade. I have tried everything.gave up. When looking on Logitech support forums, it is a common issue, but Logitech won't acknowledge it.
customer_reviews.author: fierfaerie

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard Yet, But Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth connection works great with good range. Battery has excellent endurance. Keys have perfect feel and layout. I love not having a keypad forcing me to reach way to the right to operate a mouse. The only problem is the bulky built in wrist pad and only marginally useful touch pad on the right making the overall keyboard larger than necessary and reducing the benefit of no keypad. If Logitech would fix those bits the keyboard would be perfect and I would gladly pay the same amount. I still give it 4 stars and hope Logitech removes the fluff and comes out with a more refined version with just the necessities.
customer_reviews.author: PNWConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Touchdisc can be defective - Logitech knows about it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard around the 3rd week of October 2010. Everything worked great, EXCEPT the Touchdisc, which was defective. I had the same problem as others - it just wouldn't respond unless you pressed down extremely hard, and would then barely budge on the screen. I called Logitech, and after giving them the codes off the bottom of the keyboard, they stated that this is a known defect. Logitech emailed me a UPS return label, and as soon as I shipped the defective keyboard, they had a new keyboard sent to me. Otherwise, it's a great keyboard! I'm using it with a HTPC.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Once the battery dies, your screwed.
customer_reviews.text: Once the battery dies, your screwed. tried to replace it and it still does not work. To bad, because it was a nice keyboard. Now it has become e-waste.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Swope Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Just a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these things over the past 5 years or so (gave one to my wife). Just a really great keyboard for doing straightahead writing. The keys are low and quick, which enables you to just buzz along easily. Controls are smartly laid out, volume bar is really nice when listening to iTunes or whatever. I tried using another keyboard for about a week then just threw that one out the window and bought another one of these. My suspicion is that once you try this one you'll be hooked.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Delaney

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, hyper touch disk
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for a month. It is a great keyboard. I have dismissed my mouse and replaced it with the Touch Disc. It works but is sometimes finiky and I find myself suddenly opening items that I just passed over without clicking. Some files also move to other locations just because I passed my cursor over them without clicking. So I am being extra careful when I move my cursor making sure I go over empty areas. If I cannot master this finiky Disc I may have to call back my mouse. :) I still will keep my keyboard, love the accuracy, the short cut keys and the battery which is so easily recharged.
customer_reviews.author: gato

customer_reviews.title: Unusual Delete Key
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this keyboard I read some of the reviews, and remembered at least one reviewer complaining about the oversized delete key. At the time I thought this was inconsequential. Not so. As you can see from the photos, the delete key is larger than the enter key. On all other keyboards I've used it's the opposite. I've used the Edge for about a month now, everday at the office. I still routinely hit the delete key when I really want enter, and vice versa. Perhaps one day I'll adapt, but for now it's annoying. The only other problem I've had is that on occasion the mouse pointer will stick momentarially. Other than that it's worked quite well.
customer_reviews.author: John St John

customer_reviews.title: Slick keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a home theatre PC, and it works well from 15 ft. Its a slick looking keyboard. Its very shiny and well built. I just plugged in the USB drive and it worked right out of the box. The only complaint I have with it is the scroll feature is a little hard to use, I can only get it to work about 50% of the time. However there is a page up and page down button that are accessible and almost easier to use anyways. I would highly recommend it as a HTPC keyboard because it looks really nice in the charger cradle off to the side, its not intrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Ryanmschroder

customer_reviews.title: best keyboard for HTPC
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best Home Theater PC (HTPC) keyboard on the market. I just sold my BTC keyboard that was recommended by a snap stream BTV review. In truth, BTC makes good HTPC keyboards, but for my configuration (usb extender over cat 5 with a ASUS P5W-DH) this keyboard is great, and it solved some of my major BTC issues (drivers were constantly being inactivated on resume from sleep/standby with the BTC RF keyboard). Logitech also has much better customer support then BTC (BTC's customer support was almost non-existent). Overall, if you're building a HTPC spend the money and get this keyboard (it will save you a lot of configuration headaches).
customer_reviews.author: Ellis B. Johns

customer_reviews.title: Keybaord great, charging unit delicate and breakes making keyboard useless.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fabulously for a good while. This keyboard has a design flaw in the power cord that connects to the charging base. It is delicate and breaks after usage even if you are careful with it. Can't replace just the charger unit. So now we have a nice keyboard that can't be charged and used anymore. So contrary to how popular this is, we do NOT recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. James B. Leahy

customer_reviews.title: Edge keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have had this for sometime, and I must say that I love this keyboard. It is very smooth. Keystrokes are about as effortless as it could be. Lack of a number keypad is not an issue for me since I use this at home controlling a pc for music playback. It is really nice to type on this as compared to other keyboards because it is so smooth. I highly recommend. Have had this for more than a year and have had no problems with using this daily.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Atomic

customer_reviews.title: very nice keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance buying this pricey keyboard but I've been very satisfied with it. The look and feel are great. The key layout is very well thought out, with buttons like mute and mouse-click in all the right places. The only downside is the touchpad, which is so small and cramped -- not much larger than a postage stamp -- as to be rendered useless. Instead of the touchpad, I use an external ergonomic mouse (the joystick mouse made by 3M). Overall, though, I am very pleased with the keyboard and recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: a_guy_in_boston

customer_reviews.title: great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: keyboard is very appealing to the eye, very thin and very sturdy. just like using a keyboard on a laptop. haven't used any of the special functions, but the scroll pad works well. I've heard alot of people complain that the sensitivity is too high. I think that it's just fine, you just have to get used to the placement of it. The only thing that I wish it had was backlit keys, and a number pad would be nice. all in all it's a great product, I've had it for a couple months now and have only charged it twice.
customer_reviews.author: JnAZ

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully designed.
customer_reviews.text: Sleek, sexy, and efficient. Works great right out the box. Only gripe I have is that the keys are more similar to a laptops keys than a regular keyboard or a mechanical keyboard. That's just personal preference though but the keyboard is great. Now, if they released a mechanical version with some more tactile feedback I'd be sold on this. Beautiful product though.
customer_reviews.author: D. Le

customer_reviews.title: Nice Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I really like this keyboard, especially that it lasts for 60 days on a full charge (I wish the performance mouse worked like that!). The only glitch is with the software. For some reason the last update, the volume and capital lock does not display on the screen when activating them. It doesn't affect the keyboards functions, just it is nice to see a visual of the volume setting on screen when adjusting it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M. Gaerisch

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Amazing keyboard, when i firat opened it noticed that the number 2 and 3 keys were not on the board the were somewhere in the box. i have had laptops for about 7 years now so by now i know how to reinsert the keys that pop out. Once the keys were reinserted just pressed connect on the USB key and the keyboard and voila i was done, everything works as advertised and the backlight when using the mouse is simply amazing. Because i had to reinsert the key myself i am giving it 4 out of 5 stars, i am just glad it was something simple to rectify.
customer_reviews.author: R. Maraj

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bluetooth Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is being used in a conference room along with a bluetooth mouse. The keyboard by far has stolen the show. People love it, they even don't mind using the touchpad to mouse around if it means never taking their hands off the keyboard. Sleek, smooth and definitely has that "cool" factor for execs. Battery life is great, 5 minute charge last all day, 24 hour charge lasts all month. Yeah its expensive for a keyboard, but completely worth it if you have to have a bluetooth keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: D. Viti

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Keyboarad
customer_reviews.text: Delivered earlier than I expected. Works as advertised. Mouse click on the upper left side of keyboard is great. I bought it to use on my 58" Samsung Plasma. I hook up my laptop to the tv and insert the blue tooth into the usb and it runs immediately. However ist not as practical as I had hoped. Being 15 feet away from the screen for e-mail and everyday net surfing isnt that great. I will persevere however because I think the technolgy is awsome. My 3 year old grandaughter loves calling up MS Word, putting the font on 72, increasing the size to 200%, puting the caps lock on and making giant letters on the big screen.
customer_reviews.author: HDL

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with windows 7
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard because I wanted to go wireless. I love it. Mouse wheel on the side is convenient. Works fine with Windows 7. I just plugged it in and it played! No need for the driver cd or any bloatware of Logitech. Construction is great, and battery life has been hard for me to judge since it's been exactly a month and a half and I haven't needed to charge it (consistent daily use). The only cons are no numberpad and no backlight. But i can't complain, this keyboard was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M

customer_reviews.title: Purchased as a gift for someone else
customer_reviews.text: Another excellent product from Logitech. When I did a search on internet for the best keyboards out there, irrespective of the websites, all brought me to this keyboard. Its a huge keyboard, I like the keys much better on the illuminating keyboard of logitech, but these are great too. The little track pad is also a huge positive on this. If you are looking out for the best keyboard in the market, probably this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: iknaappan

customer_reviews.title: awesome keybpard
customer_reviews.text: i have this wireless keyboard for 2 months now. its very convenient. i can browse the net away from the desk or monitor.i could sit on the sofa or sit on my massage chair. so far no system or glitch problem with the keyboard. the circular touchpad is very convenient and very responsive.the keyboard sits on my lap comfortably and its light.and no wires, no batteries to replace. just put it back it its dock and there its charging itself while not in use.im so happy with my wireless logitech dinovo edge.
customer_reviews.author: xteene

customer_reviews.title: Logitech diNovo Edge keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have several of this product and I highly recommend it to businesss owners interested in high productivity output, dependability and full functionality in a keyboard. The diNovo edge is a full featured keyboard with integrated mouse, media, volume, web and a zoom control button that I've found to be very useful in enlarging screen text size. The keyboard is easy to install and is very realiable. I would like to see the optional numeric pad integrated into the product as well. I rate the product *****
customer_reviews.author: Labam

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've owned at least a dozen keyboards over the past 10 years, but this is by far the best. It charges extremely fast and holds the charge for a very long time. The keys feel great and are super quiet. It also looks and feels great. The only drawback for me is the lack of a number pad, but I've learned to live without it. If they ever make this keyboard with a number pad, I'd get that. I liked it so much I bought a second one for our other computer. It's not cheap, but it's a great keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2010. I still use it and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy E

customer_reviews.title: Edge Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several keyboards over the years, some better than others, but none came close to the Logitech diNovo Edge unit. It's truly in a class by itself. Though a bit pricey, even with a rebate, the extra money I spent for this unit underscores the adage "you get what you pay for." In this case you not only get solid construction, great key response, lots of handy extras, you also get pleasing styling and appearance. Installation went smoothly, no hitches. A top of the line keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon D

customer_reviews.title: Style is not optional
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest, I bought this keyboard to LOOK COOL next to my PlayStation 3 in the living room; and it does that in spades. It works with the PS3 Bluetooth, so the included dongle is not needed. Various keys perform the PS3 button functions (Enter=X, ESC=O, F1=square, and F2=trangle, etc); but looking back, the PS3-specific wireless keyboard might have been a more liveable (and cheaper) option. The touchdisc works like a usual touchpad with some scrolling aids (which take a little patience). The keyboard can be operated just fine using two hands or on your lap.
customer_reviews.author: R. Klug

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a very attractive keyboard and if you like gadgets and doo dads this is up your ally - but if you like a number key pad, like I do, you will be sad when you get your keyboard and realize, like I did, that this one doesn't have it. I was distracted by the doo dads and missed that. So I gave it to my gamer-non-keypad-needing husband and he gave me his plain jane wireless keyboard and we are all happy again.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Roberts

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is just awesome! The battery lasts for months (After I bought it I didn't charge it for three months and I use it almost dayly. At some point it got creeky so I just pout it in the charger ;-)). Keyboard feels good and the mouse works super. It also has a left mouse button on the other side of the keyboard so that it's easy to use the mouse when you have it on your lap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wieland

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard. Just what you're looing for.
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't come with a cord =( But the battery lasts a long-ass time. It's pretty slick and responds well with my computer. Though it has to be near the PC. Nice and slick. Looks good. Relatively light The keys do not luminate =( so it gets a 4-star. I was lied to.
customer_reviews.author: Justmetmt

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but beats the competition for HTPC
customer_reviews.text: I tried a cheaper model before getting the diNovo Edge, and I just wasted money and time (although maybe my experience helped me find peace with the diNovo's hefty price tag). This is everything you would expect a wireless HTPC keyboard to be. The most important feature relative to its competition is the usable pointing device; it functions like a laptop's touchpad. It is the perfect input device for our Windows 7 Media Center connected to our 52" TV.
customer_reviews.author: Bears

customer_reviews.title: This Keyboard Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I use this keyboard with my Dell M1530 laptop and Windows Vista. The main reason for having the Logitech was to connect the laptop to my flat panel TV and use the Bluetooth keyboard remotely. The DiNovo works very well, and it is also one elegant piece of equipment. The keyboard is very thin and rests in its charging station when not in use. The workmanship is excellent, looks and feels high end. The mousepad works well. The battery lasts forever it seems.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, takes a minute to startup sometimes...
customer_reviews.text: Most everything about this keyboard is awesome. It feels good and looks pretty classy. The only real CONS i have are that 1) taking my computer out of standby it can take up to 30sec to reconnect which is a long time when you are sitting there counting every second and 2) Every once in a blue moon it will lose connections randomly as if I am too far from the bluetooth dongle (Im always within 15ft). Besides that its a sweet keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an HTPC
customer_reviews.text: With its built-in touchpad, I use this for my HTPC and it fits the bill perfectly. It's light, it's crazy thing, it gets great battery life, and it's stylish enough to leave it out in the charger and still look like itbelongs. I like the charging dock as well, it's very convenient and easy to just throw it on there whenever you're not using it. The range is plenty to work with any TV, I don't think you could sit far enough away that this thing wouldn't reach.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Logitech diNovo Edge  review
customer_reviews.text: The first one that I received started working as soon as I plugged in the USB bluetooth receiver and all functionas worked except the touchpad disc. After troubleshooting online with Logitech, we determined that this was defective. I received another one at blazing speeds both due to the excellent Logitech support as well as incredible return policy which made it a pleasure to work with Amazon. The second keyboard works flawlessly. Absolutley a piece of art.
customer_reviews.author: Irfan Uddin

customer_reviews.title: Over two years and no problems, third year battery was dead.
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would love such a keyboard, but with hdmi from pc to tv, this keyboard is a dream come true. For most people the only room for improvement would be a numeric keyboard. I don't remember paying so much for mine, I saw it recently for $160.00. Don't get me wrong, it is worth it to me, but that price could make most think twice. The only great improvement would have been using AA NiMH batteries instead of built in non replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: JPinCA

customer_reviews.title: Nicest keyboard I have experienced
customer_reviews.text: Great low profile keyboard. Great grip/never slips - it felt like it was nailed to the desk. Love the Touchpad. Running your finger clockwise or counterclockwise around the edge of the Touchpad is the easiest and most natural way to navigate up and down a page I have ever experienced. This is not a mechanical keyboard but the slightest depression of a key is all that is needed.
customer_reviews.author: James B. Carr

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not only does the keyboard look great with its glowing lights and touch-sensitivity, but the key touch and travel is really great. It looks nice and works great, and that's a hard combination to find. It worked immediately with my Dell Latitude 620 (with built-in bluetooth), so I didn't bother to install the software because I've heard bad things about it. So basically right out of the box I was able to start using this thing after a brief charge.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Really worth the high price tag
customer_reviews.text: Truly a piece of art when displayed upon the recharging dock. The battery does seem to last forever, so in an effort to not hurt the bateery i keep the charging dock unpluged so i can still display the keyboard, but i dont have to have it needlessly be charging. I kind of do miss a side numerical keypad, but not so much as to want another keyboard. the touchpad is a nice option, i find that the horizontal scrolling feature could use some fine tuning though.
customer_reviews.author: Ali K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard even after 3+ years
customer_reviews.text: Got this keyboard in 2009. Still works great. I use this on a computer that uses the TV for a monitor. Works great, no need for a separate mouse. I've recently been wishing this had a number pad so I could use it for work. However, that would make the keyboard too big for what I initially bought it for (sitting on the couch with it) so I can't really knock it for that. Love the orange glow.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: not really the most advanced keyboard... but an OK one
customer_reviews.text: my dream keyboard with budget over $100 must have this: 1. solar powered 2. back lit capable 3. stylish and thin (like this one) 4. ease and reliable of connection 5. better productivity (lack of number keypad is definitely not helping) 6. fun to use: dedicated keys for multimedia (this one, you have to use Fn + sth combo) the trackpad sucks, considering that this keyboard was introduced to the market more than 4 years ago, you might accept all the shortcomings. If I had done more research, I would not buy this keyboard. It was an impulsive buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: Li Zeng

customer_reviews.title: A for product, c for effort
customer_reviews.text: so the product got here on time, had a suprisingly large amount of charge already on it compared to other blutooth items ive purchased and works wondefully so far. The downside was that, there are a few dings and scraped on the package frsh out of the box. While, its not something im going to send the product back over, and its on the edges, not on the surface or anything like that, I'm just a little upset when a product comes with cosmetic defections right out of the box. Someone at Logitech probably needs to make sure their employees in charge of this type of thing should be doing their job a little bit better
customer_reviews.author: Kapp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wireless keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wireless keyboard. The range specified is probably only realistic in a lab. My CPU is in the basement of my house but with USB extension cables it works really well. The onboard "touch pad" works fine but I recommend that you install the included software to make that more functional, it's really nice to have mouse type capabilities on the keyboard. I wonder why this isn't more promenent in the description of this product?
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bowie

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for use with PS3, works well.
customer_reviews.text: Took it out of the box, hit connect, fired up the PS3, went to Accessories > Manage Bluetooth Devices > Register Device. PS3 immediately recognized the keyboard and easily paired. F1, F3, F5 are your important keys when navigating through the browser. The only thing I'm upset about is that it had an ugly black smudge in the center of the palm rest right out of the package! (picture to follow) It's small but very noticedable. I don't know if this is an Amazon or Logitech issue but I'm willing to live with it if the keyboard continues to have no functional issues. Haven't paired with my Netbook yet - standby for more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Njus

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, however....
customer_reviews.text: I loved using this keyboard. It was my home theater/server wireless keyboard. It's comfortable to use and works well. Unfortunately, as I recently discovered, if you lose or damage the charging base your keyboard becomes worthless. This is because Logitech does not sell a replacement base, only a replacement AC adapter. This is completely unacceptable for such an expensive, high-end keyboard. I won't be purchasing another after my now-useless Edge loses its final charge.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Van Anderson

customer_reviews.title: HTPC Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the HTPC used in the home theater room. Controls a Windows 7 PC. The built in trackpad is great addition. The design is very minimalistic. Has decent wireless range since the computer is in a separate room from the theater and there is no lag visible on screen when using the keyboard from any set in the theater. Purchased the item in October of 2009 and the battery has held up since.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ruvio

customer_reviews.title: Great Design and Function
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Very slick design and docking stand is convenient. Holds a charge for a very long time (they claim up to 2 months). The built-in touch pad is a nice feature, as are the back-lit function keys (e.g., volume control slider). The Bad: Although the unit came with a USB Bluetooth receiver, I figured it would not be required on a Bluetooth enabled PC - not true (at least in my experience). A great keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: MGB

customer_reviews.title: i would buy another one if it ever did break
customer_reviews.text: ive owned this keyboard for sometime now. im writing this to let others know its performance.in the 5 years ive owned this i have had very few issues with this product. the mouse is very responsive and the keyboard itself is relatively light. ive never needed service nor batteries. it holds a charge for more than a few hours with heavy use.it did take some getting used to and setting the hot keys is time consuming but even if the unit discharges it has not lost its settings...i recommend this to anyone that is looking to streamline their wireless experience. i welcome any questions regarding this.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle E. Oneill

customer_reviews.title: New Age Product
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased the wireless Logitech MX Revolution mouse and found this to be the best mouse (corded or cordless). Decided to finally upgrade keyboard and after reading reviews got the diNovo Edge. Even though the instructions are almost nil, it was not that bad to figure out the keyboard and its functions. Typing on this keyboard is effortless, accurate and smooth beyond belief. You have to try this!!
customer_reviews.author: K. benford

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard looks nice and functions very well. It was great having the trackpad/mouse built in to the keyboard.. so nice that I opted not to buy a mouse at all.. until just a couple months later the trackpad seems to have lost all functionality. Mind you, the keyboard has been kept in pristine condition - the protective film is still on it.
customer_reviews.author: Rawrcasm

customer_reviews.title: Great for Home Theater PCs
customer_reviews.text: Great addition for a hometheater PC. Product functions just as advertised with good connectivity and long battery life. The keyboard back light really helps in low light situations. The charging stand makes for an easy place to store the keyboard while not in use and makes remembering to charge the keyboard easy.
customer_reviews.author: Pabber

customer_reviews.title: Great Media Center Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's small, light, thin, and the rechargable battery is great. Of the keyboards out there with an integrated touchpad, this one is clearly one of the best. The scrolling function on the touchpad is especially well implemented. The only button I wish it did have was a dedicated button to bring up Windows Media Center. Oh, the software lacks some features / options to that I think should be standard, especially if you use it with other Logitech bluetooth devices.
customer_reviews.author: P. Clemins

customer_reviews.title: Logitech diNovo Edge Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard to connect to a PC that is connected to the Family TV. We wanted to be able to view and control You Tube and Hulu videos, Facebook and other items on the large LCD TV. This keyboard is perfect for this type of activity. If you intend to use it for all other PC use you may not be as satisfied and may want to add a wireless mouse. Also purchased from Amazon.com at a substantial savings over the local stores.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fantastic keyboard, work of art and bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is really great. Unbelievably thin and light, I am able to use it with any bluetooth enabled device (Desktop, Laptop, even my Blackberry). I really love the design of the keyboard, very sleek. The touch-sensitive glass touch pad and volume control are also very cool. Add good battery life, great key stroke, and really cool orange lights that activate when you touch the Fn key, volume control or touch pad and you have a winner. Expensive, but really the best keyboard I have ever had. Absolutely no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Over 4 years going strong!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for $150 on amazon 4 years ago. I thought of writing a review since I was looking at new keyboards since my new HP Envy 17 3D has a full backlit keyboard. Well, I don't think I'll find a replacement for my home entertainment PC that is better than the diNovo! I would pick another up at $100 if I needed one! So no new keyboards for me for now...
customer_reviews.author: Rickey C. Miller

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard - one quirk
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice keyboard that has the added advantage of having the touchpad built in so you don't need a mouse. I use it with my media center PC and it has great range. Compared to the IR keyboards the range is much further, I would say ten times as far. The only bother is the battery indicator light looks half full, even when full. Also, it's made in China but seems OK despite that.
customer_reviews.author: George W.

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, stands the test of time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard about 5 years ago from Amazon. It has stood the test of time and the battery still works great. The little mini mouse pad is kind of useless, but the keyboard is great. It is very slim and sleek on my desk. The charging stand really makes this a nice addition to the office, because I can put in on the stand out of the way to use the desk space.
customer_reviews.author: NewSchoolBeats

customer_reviews.title: It misses on the fundamentals ... keys don't work and connection breaks
customer_reviews.text: I am very frustrated with this keyboard. Some of the keys just quite working. It looks nice, but I would rather have it work. It does not have a numberic pad which is frstrating if you use ALT keys. I need to unplug the adaptor and replug it every time I startup my computer. Overall, I am sorry I bought it and even more so that I bought two of them.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Flyer

customer_reviews.title: SLIM, SLICK and PERFORMS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Would never purchase any other keyboard out there...and i've tried them all...even the ergonomic Microsoft version with a mouse. But developed a pulled muscle in shoulder and shooting pains down right arm after 365 days of usage non-stop three hrs/day. Best of all, I don't develop arthritis in the fingers due to a condensed keyboard version. LOGITECH KNOWS. LOGITECH PERFORMS. I DO USE AN ELONGATED WRIST PAD TO SUPPORT MY HANDS UPRIGHT! LOVE IT!!!! LOGITECH ROCKS!!!*****
customer_reviews.author: Carina Burns

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard ever. Track pad is fluid, and the battery life lasts for weeks
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Henry

customer_reviews.title: Sold by "weshiptech" as being in "very good" condition. ...
customer_reviews.text: Sold by "weshiptech" as being in "good" condition. Hairy spores are growing on and under the keys and a sticky residue is present around the edges of the unit. It most certainly is not in "good" condition. I'll let the photos say the rest...
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Super Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for an old (but good, I thought) Gateway keyboard. This is the best keyboard I've used in my 30 years of using computers. Well built and for me it's the Rolls Royce of keyboards. The fact that it is a smaller layout works fine for me. I have average sized hands that fit very nicely on the soft touch keys. Plus it is a classy looking piece
customer_reviews.author: Bern N.

customer_reviews.title: Watch-out 64 bit Vista users
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard with some interesting features. Among them the attempt to do away with the need for a mouse with a multifunctional keypad and a left click button on the left of the keyboard. BUT, it is not fully functional if you are using 64 bit Vista. Specifically, the scroll left/right function will not work, despite the up/down scroll being fine. A Logitech tech and I discovered this by testing on another keyboard. There may be other 64 bit glitches I have not found yet. But not enough to stop me from finding it to be a very nice keyboard. But all OEMs should make their equipment fully 64 bit compatible because the profile is mainstream now.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great keyboard!! Easy to install. Very light and power lasts forever with a single charge.. It is a nice looking and stylish keyboard...Cons: Touchpad needs to ba a little more sensitive on the tapping part, or the software needs to incorporate a tap sensitivity adjustment.. other than the numbers pad is missing that I rarely use its worth every penny !!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vandiver

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a good keybaord this is the one.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard for longer than I can remember. Maybe 5 years or more. Typing on it is the best. the battery works very well. I love the stand as it keeps the keyboard out of the way when needed. The battery last a very long time so I don't need to charge it very often.
customer_reviews.author: Dave D

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: The diNovo Edge does a good job of giving basic control over a multimedia computer at a comfortable viewing distance. The bluetooth connection is stable (it works fine w/o the optional drivers in WinXP and in Ubuntu linux) and the response time is good. I like the keyboard feel, layout, and lighting effects. The mouse pad works ok, but is not suitable for fine work or fast gaming. It is fine for basic operations. So, overall, I find this product very usable.
customer_reviews.author: richard tennis

customer_reviews.title: Super Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this one. It does it all and works in most setups. At first I was worried that it wouldn't work before an OS boots up but then I realized you can plug in the USB BT receiver and it works like a charm even during BIOS loading. Works flawlessly in Windows and even in Linux. The mousepad is handy but for serious use you'll still need an actual mouse. Rechargeable BT this one is king.
customer_reviews.author: B. Marley

customer_reviews.title: A Piece of Art and Functional too !
customer_reviews.text: Wow, If looks could move a mountain, the mountain would be movin'. Is it Art or Technology? Both. The touch on the keyboard is fantastic and all the keys feel alike (which is good). The Integral pointer pad is not for every-day use and needs to be supplemented by a real lazer mouse, but is damn convenient when you have this puppy in your lap. Installation was a little strange until you figure out that you need to press the connect button on both the usb dongle and the keyboard to get them to link up. You also need your old keyboard until you get this one linked up. Nice Product !
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Gorgens

customer_reviews.title: Best Keyboard ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my third DiNovo, The first one I used for yeards until the letter were no longer viewable so I now use it at home, the second one met with an early death as I jammed it under my desk when closing up shop, could not be fixed. I had a replacement which I hated, so happy I am reunited with a new one!
customer_reviews.author: DiDo555

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!
customer_reviews.text: Looks and functions great - the only thing I didn't like is the orange back on the keyboard. The keyboard looks like an art piece from the front and the orange back just totally ruined it. Also, don't be fooled into thinking this is a fragile keyboard by how thin it looks. If you search for a video on youtube, you'll find somebody testing the durability of this unit by throwing it down a hill multiple times and it still worked fine. (I don't know why somebody would do that to an expensive keyboard, but hey, it proves a point)
customer_reviews.author: Katano

customer_reviews.title: an elegant keyboard, for a more civilized age.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I bought this thing solely to act as my HTPC keyboard. In that regard, it is fantastic. Everything works fine in Win7. I leave it on my coffee table sometimes for 2-3 weeks before it needs a recharge. While the price is high, if you're trying to build a sleek home theater setup, I'm sure you're already used to paying the premium price.
customer_reviews.author: gehsekky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this keyboard for almost 3 years. It works flawlessly!! I spend a lot of time typing daily, and have never encountered any of the negative issues that some reviewers are reporting. I have purchased 3 additional diNovo Edge keyboards for family members and we have had no issues with any of them!! We love them!!!
customer_reviews.author: My Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard has great feel and nice design. The programmable functions are nice. The only drawback is the mouse pad. It is not something you will want to use a lot. Sensitivity is not intuitive and it will frustrate you with extensive use. If you are buying this keyboard because you don't want to use a separate mouse anymore, you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Distance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to be used in our home media room. I needed something that would provide greater distance with a built in mouse as my computer was several feet away in another room. The computer I attached the device to is older and currently being replaced. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that the range was exceptional and the device easily installed; I was even able to control the computer from most rooms in my home. The design is ergonomic and well designed. I'm looking forwarded to using the device once we finish installing the HDMI cable to our flat screen and the new video computer arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Carl William Sisco

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard for conference rooms
customer_reviews.text: I've installed this keyboard in several conference rooms. I love that it is always charged up, no more messing with changing batteries. It also has great range and no issues with that. It looks great too and that's usually important in conference rooms. It's expensive, but it always works and that's worth paying more in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I'm considering a second for the other computer
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best keyboard I've ever used. The touchpad works absolutely great. I needed a keyboard with integrated touchpad so that I could leave the ThinkPad laptop closed and out of the way, and instead use an external keyboard and flat screen LED display. This has worked so well, I'm considering getting a second for the other computer.
customer_reviews.author: G. Martin

customer_reviews.title: too good!
customer_reviews.text: + : 1) its one of the sleekest machines on earth. 2) Aesthetics- top class 3) compact 4) great comfort - : 1) no numeric pad 2) the tocuh pad function not upto the mark 3) finger print is a mess, need to celan every minute if you want the look to be retained.
customer_reviews.author: Adil Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: DiNovo Three
customer_reviews.text: Great product, with reservations. Bluetooth works well, great ergonomics and feel. Beautiful to look at, But features are flawed. The touch screen does not function, lights up, but does not work. Can not find a solution. I am using Windows 7 Ultimate with 8 gigs ram. Also i had to disable sleep mode, computer would not return to operation after sleep mode, required reboot.This is my third DiNovo and will be going back if Logitech support doesnt provide answers.
customer_reviews.author: Captain C.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product for a customer to use in a goofy situation where it wasn't ideal for a normal mouse to be used. The end users are not tech folks whatsoever and all were able to use the keyboard without much of a learning curve. Of course there is no numeric key pad on the side like stanard keyboard, but who cares, type writers didn't have them either. It's not an issue if you learn how to type. I would buy this product for myself and for anyone else who I felt it could work for due to simplicity.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Very Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Best keyboard I've ever laid hands on. Nice feel. Nice touch pad as well (if you like the touch pad, no need to purchase a mouse). There are some problems with the OS coming out of S1 S3 sleep modes. You may have to hit the connect button on both the keyboard and provided Bluetooth adapter.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lopes

customer_reviews.title: My favorite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I found this keyboard on the internet several years ago and own two of them. I am touch typist and love the keyboard for fast and accurate typing. In addition, the keyboard has convenient "hot keys" to increase the volume of the speaker, mute the speaker and move the screen cursor all with the touch of the finger. I bought this new one to replace one after over 6-7 years of use of my original one because the wireless connection failed. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: PegasusBay

customer_reviews.title: "Almost" perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Setup is extremely simple: just plug in the USB dongle. -Keyboard and mouse pad work flawlessly. Cons: -The scroll function does not work well. I connect my big screen TV to a PC. This keyboard is "almost" perfect for operating the PC from my recliner.
customer_reviews.author: Golf4fun42

customer_reviews.title: i love it
customer_reviews.text: works great; sleek, slim, sharp design; extremely long battery life; sometimes i would be nice if there was a number pad but for the most part i don't miss it. now if there was only 1 receiver that worked with all of logitech's wireless devices... this is the only reason i didn't give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Moomaw

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I still use this as my main keyboard. The thing must be seven or eight years old by now!
customer_reviews.author: Metal By Numbers

customer_reviews.title: Going on 4 years!!!
customer_reviews.text: wow!, i cant believe ive had this keyboard for almost 4 years now!...typing on it right now!....Absolutely love the battery life on it between charges! About 1-2 months!.....And im on the internet every day for 2+ hours! It was about $200 at Frys at the time I bought it from Amazon for $145
customer_reviews.author: x-man

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but would be nicer if the keys were back lit
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works great. It is as responsive as a wired keyboard yet more convenient. It has great range. We can use it from across the room. The battery seems to last forever. It would be nicer if the keys were back lit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Underimpressed
customer_reviews.text: The key board is OK - nothing special worth that amount of money. The biggest drawback is the "mouse". It is so small so as to make it useless and I still use my regular mouse anyway. The feel of the keyboard is good (although it arrived with one key off). I had trouble making the software work with my previous Logitech devices already installed. Since neither keyboard showed up in the software, I had to uninstall it but it wouldn't take both of them, which it should be able to do. The look is nice and charging unique. So it's OK but nothing that special nor worth that price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was awesome until it stopped charging and you can't replace the battery w/o voiding warranty!!! GRRRRRRR!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Good product but pricey
customer_reviews.text: I think that this is a beautifully designed product, and does what it says it will do. BUT - I don't think you have to spent $ 100 to get this functionality. We settled on a less expensive battery operated model for our conference rooms as 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Perlman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard
customer_reviews.text: this is a fantastic keyboard, I am currently using it to BT with my media center. for all those times that I cant find my mouse, i simply use the track pad on this keybard. works great! I have this device next to my sofa on the charger, surprisingly it actually looks pretty in my modern home.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome with one Fatal Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars in a heart beat, but right before writing this review i went to get something off my keyboard and learned that this thing has no protection.. with just my fingernail i permanently ruined my keyboard. This thing catches scratches, makes them look deep and stick out... Total Failure on a keyboards part. now there is no point of having a fancy display stand or anything of the sort!
customer_reviews.author: CJ Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Feel and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the key travel and spacing on this keyboard... a feel you get only from Logitech. Really solid construction and they're telling the truth when they claim that it will run for a day on only five minutes of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Bob
